thread.title: PM To Set Out EU Demands In November
thread.title_full: PM To Set Out EU Demands In November

title: PM To Set Out EU Demands In November
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Fri, Oct 16, 2015, 14:08 BST - UK Markets close in 2 hrs 22 mins PM To Set Out EU Demands In November By (c) Sky News 2015 | Sky News – 3 hours ago View Photo 

The Prime Minister has said he will announce the details of his demands for a new deal for Britain with the EU at the beginning of November. 
David Cameron said he would "quicken the pace" of his renegotiations with European leaders after coming under pressure in Brussels over his failure to spell out his demands. 
Mr Cameron has promised to have an agreement on changes for Britain before putting the country’s continued membership of the EU to the vote in a referendum by the end of 2017. 
Speaking as he arrived for talks with European Parliament President Martin Schulz in Brussels, Mr Cameron said: "We will... be discussing the British referendum. That has now got under way and is going well." 
He added: "The pace will now quicken and I'll be again setting out the four vital areas where we need change and laying down what those changes will be at the start of November… 
"I'm confident we can get a good deal for Britain, we can fix those things that need to be fixed and I'm confident this process is well under way and making good progress." 
:: Should The UK Stay Or Go? 
Mr Schulz had called for Mr Cameron to make his position clear. He said: "I hope that, as far as the UK Government is concerned - and certainly with individuals, including David Cameron - we can make steps forward. 
"Above all, we need clarity on what we are going to be discussing over the next few months." 
Mr Cameron met European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker for lunch for talks over the technical discussions on the renegotiations which Mr Juncker said had not made huge progress. 
Mr Juncker, with whom Mr Cameron has had a strained relationship in the past, told MEPs "our British friends have to dance" and said that it took "two to tango". 
He had already sparked controversy after appearing to say that Britain didn't need Europe and Europe didn't need Britain but has said that his words were misheard because of the noise in parliament on Wednesday. 
He told Sky News: "Britain needs Europe and Europe needs Britain" and said progress had to be made on renegotiation talks. 
The most likely date for the referendum is expected to be autumn 2016.
